page.title: 14MY VILLAGE: HAZEL SLADE
page.content: {Hazel Slade} is a very quiet village on the edge of{Cannock Chase}, which is designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty. The Chase is owned mainly by the Forestry Commission as a commercial forest but people can enjoy it for walks, picnics and nature study. Hazel Slade has a number of amenities. It has two parks, a nature reserve, a public house with a garden, a general shop, and a Post Office, so most essential items can be bought in the village. The park equipment is usually damaged so when I get home I often watch television or play my records. It can be dangerous to walk alone in concealed areas, but generally Hazel Slade is a pleasant and peaceful place to live.
